column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of APdH3 were synthesized by hydrogenation of a APd alloy as follows.
#Text=Starting materials of A granules and Pd powder were used in the molar ratio of A : Pd = 1.1 : 1.0 and mixed in a He-filled glove box.
#Text=A slight excess amount of A was to compensate for the loss of A due to evaporation during the induction melting process.
#Text=The APd alloy was prepared through the induction melting of the mixture placed on a Mo boat in a carbon crucible under He atmosphere and then ground into powder.
#Text=Then, hydrogenation of the APd alloy was carried out under 0.5 MPa of hydrogen gas for 24 h at room temperature.
#Text=As shown in Fig. 1, the APd was put into an evacuated glass tube with the mixture of CaH2 and CuO as a hydrogenation source.
#Text=The APd alloy was kept at room temperature, while the mixture of CaH2 and CuO was heated at ~150 .
#Text=The pressure of hydrogenation gas was controlled by the amount of CaH2 and the volume of the glass tube.
#Text=Polycrystalline PdHx was also prepared by the hydrogenation of Pd powder by the same method.
#Text=The powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) analysis was carried out using Cu K radiation at room temperature.
#Text=Magnetic susceptibility measurements were performed using a superconducting quantum interface device (SQUID) magnetometer for the detection of superconductivity.
